abstract: California officials seek Obama administration approval for undocumented immigrants to buy health insurance on state's public exchange; say up to 30 percent of state's undocumented adults could be eligible for program.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Officials say that up to 30 percent of the state’s two million undocumented adults could be eligible for the program, which could face serious hurdles as it seeks federal approval.
snippet: Officials say that up to 30 percent of the state’s two million undocumented adults could be eligible for the program, which could face serious hurdles as it seeks federal approval....

headline.main: California Moves to Allow Undocumented Immigrants to Buy Insurance
headline.print_headline: California Seeks Insurance for Undocumented Adults
